alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Goochland; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:02AM EST until January 11 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Cartersville affecting Goochland, Powhatan and Cumberland Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Cartersville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Approach to old highway bridge and portions of the farm land on the left hand side of the river are flooded. At 23.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Secondary roads parallel to left bank of river flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EST Wednesday was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.1 feet on 04/02/1948. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EST.
